section_1_vision.vision_statement:
By 2050, Saudi Arabia will be a thriving, sustainable, and connected 
            nation where all regions prosper, cities are livable, natural heritage is preserved, 
            and every citizen has access to economic opportunity and quality of life - a global 
            model of balanced territorial development in harmony with Vision 2030 aspirations.
section_1_vision.vision_statement_ar:
بحلول عام 2050، ستكون المملكة العربية السعودية دولة مزدهرة ومستدامة 
            ومتصلة حيث تزدهر جميع المناطق، وتكون المدن صالحة للعيش، ويُحافظ على التراث الطبيعي، 
            ويتمتع كل مواطن بفرص اقتصادية وجودة حياة عالية - نموذج عالمي للتنمية الإقليمية المتوازنة 
            بانسجام مع تطلعات رؤية 2030.

guiding_principles.description: Ensure all 13 regions have distinct economic roles and adequate investment to reduce spatial inequality and concentration in top 3 regions.
Treat water as the binding constraint for all spatial development decisions. No development approval without sustainable water solution.
Develop integrated transport and economic corridors linking regions to maximize economic spillovers and reduce isolation.
Protect 30% of land and sea by 2030, mainstream climate resilience, and achieve net-zero domestic emissions by 2060.
Promote compact, mixed-use urban development around transit nodes to reduce sprawl, car dependency, and infrastructure costs.
Preserve and celebrate Saudi cultural heritage as asset for tourism, identity, and community wellbeing.
Design spatial strategies flexible enough to accommodate multiple future scenarios including climate stress and energy transition.
Every spatial policy must have clear accountability, funding mechanism, timeline, and monitoring indicators.

strategic_objectives.description: Develop 5 national-tier cities (Riyadh, Jeddah, Dammam, NEOM, Makkah) and 15 regional-tier cities as balanced growth poles
strategic_objectives.target_2050: Reduce top-3 regional population concentration from 64% to 55%

strategic_objectives.description: Establish 5 major economic corridors connecting all regions with multimodal transport and economic activity
strategic_objectives.target_2050: 100% of regions within 4 hours of a national corridor

strategic_objectives.description: Achieve water security through demand reduction, supply diversification, and 100% treated wastewater reuse
strategic_objectives.target_2050: Reduce per capita water consumption by 40%, eliminate groundwater overextraction

strategic_objectives.description: Build climate adaptation into all spatial development and protect vulnerable areas
strategic_objectives.target_2050: All development designed for +3°C scenario, 30% protected areas

strategic_objectives.description: Create specialized economic zones aligned with regional competitive advantages
strategic_objectives.target_2050: Each region has distinct economic specialization with <30% oil dependency

strategic_objectives.description: Ensure all Saudis have access to quality services, green spaces, and affordable housing
strategic_objectives.target_2050: 9 sqm green space per capita, 30-min access to services, 70% housing affordability

strategic_objectives.description: Achieve universal high-speed connectivity and comprehensive transport network
strategic_objectives.target_2050: 100% fiber/5G coverage, all cities on rail network, 6 international hubs

key_messages: Your voice matters in shaping where and how Saudi Arabia develops
We want to hear about your region's needs and opportunities
The NSS will guide development for the next 25 years

faq.question: What is the National Spatial Strategy (NSS)?
faq.answer: The NSS is a comprehensive plan that guides where and how development occurs across Saudi Arabia until 2050. It coordinates land use, infrastructure, economic development, and environmental protection across all 13 regions.

faq.question: How does the NSS relate to Vision 2030?
faq.answer: The NSS translates Vision 2030's ambitious goals into spatial reality. It identifies where giga-projects, cities, corridors, and protected areas will be located to achieve Vision 2030 targets in a coordinated way.

faq.question: What are the main goals of the NSS?
faq.answer: The NSS aims to: (1) Balance development across all 13 regions, (2) Ensure water security, (3) Connect regions with transport corridors, (4) Protect the environment, (5) Improve quality of life for all Saudis.

faq.question: How will my region benefit?
faq.answer: Every region has a specific role and investment priorities in the NSS. Check the Regional Objectives section for your region's strategic role, priority sectors, and planned infrastructure investments.

faq.question: How much investment is planned?
faq.answer: The NSS identifies over SAR 1.4 trillion in priority investments across infrastructure, economic development, social services, and environmental protection over 25 years.

faq.question: Who is responsible for implementing the NSS?
faq.answer: A National NSS Coordination Authority will oversee implementation, working with line ministries, regional authorities, and the private sector. Each ministry has specific responsibilities defined in the Governance Framework.

faq.question: How can I participate?
faq.answer: Public consultation is open for 90 days. You can provide feedback through the online portal (nss.gov.sa), attend regional workshops, or submit written comments to your local municipality.

faq.question: Will the NSS affect my property?
faq.answer: The NSS provides high-level guidance that will be detailed through regional and local plans. Specific zoning changes will go through proper legal processes with affected communities consulted.

faq.question: How will water scarcity be addressed?
faq.answer: Water security is the #1 priority. The NSS mandates: 40% reduction in consumption, 100% wastewater reuse, expansion of desalination, and transition away from water-intensive agriculture.

faq.question: How will the NSS be monitored?
faq.answer: A comprehensive KPI framework tracks progress annually. Bi-annual reviews assess performance and the strategy will be updated every 5 years based on changing conditions.
